metadata.label: toJson
metadata.description: Converts a value of type `anydata` to `json`.

metadata.label: toXml
metadata.description:
Converts a `Map` or `Record` representation to its XML representation.
Additionally, when converting from a record, the `xmldata:Namespace`, `xmldata:Name`, and `xmldata:Attribute`
annotations can be used to add `namespaces`, `name of elements`, and `attributes` to XML representation.

metadata.label: mapValue
metadata.description: The `Map` or `Record` representation source to be converted to XML

metadata.label: options
metadata.description: Options to be used for filtering in the projection

metadata.label: parseAsType
metadata.description: Convert value of type `json` to subtype of `anydata`.

metadata.label: options
metadata.description: Options to be used for filtering in the projection

metadata.label: parseAsType
metadata.description: Converts XML to record type with projection.

metadata.label: options
metadata.description: Options to be used for filtering in the projection

metadata.label: read
metadata.description:
Extract details from the given JSON value using the provided query template expression.

```ballerina
read({id: 1, "name": "John Doe"}, `$.name`) => "John Doe"
```

metadata.label: prettify
metadata.description: Prettifies a `json` value to print it.

metadata.label: indentation
metadata.description: The number of spaces for an indentation

metadata.label: transform
metadata.description:
Transforms the single-rooted XML content to another XML/HTML/plain text using XSL transformations.
```ballerina
xml|error target = xslt:transform(sourceXml, xsl);
```

metadata.label: input
metadata.description: An XML object, which needs to be transformed

metadata.label: xsl
metadata.description: The XSL style sheet represented in an XML object

metadata.label: params
metadata.description: Optional parameters passed into the xslt template

metadata.label: fileReadCsv
skipHeaders
metadata.description: Number of headers, which should be skipped prior to reading records

metadata.label: fileReadJson
metadata.description:
Reads file content as a JSON.
```ballerina
json|io:Error content = io:fileReadJson("./resources/myfile.json");
```

metadata.label: path
metadata.description: The path of the JSON file

metadata.label: fileReadBytes
metadata.description:
Read the entire file content as a byte array.
```ballerina
byte[]|io:Error content = io:fileReadBytes("./resources/myfile.txt");
```

metadata.label: fileReadXml
metadata.description:
Reads file content as an XML.
```ballerina
xml|io:Error content = io:fileReadXml("./resources/myfile.xml");
```

metadata.label: document
metadata.description:
The GraphQL document. It can include queries & mutations.
For example `query OperationName($code:ID!) {country(code:$code) {name}}`.

metadata.label: operationName
metadata.description:
The GraphQL operation name. If a request has two or more operations, then each operation must have a name.
A request can only execute one operation, so you must also include the operation name to execute.

metadata.label: headers
metadata.description: The GraphQL API headers to execute each query

metadata.label: document

A request can only execute one operation, so you must also include the operation name to execute.

metadata.label: statusCode
metadata.description: Status code for closing the connection

metadata.label: timeout
metadata.description:
Time to wait (in seconds) for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value is < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection
waits until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote
endpoint within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately

metadata.label: port
metadata.description: Port number of the MySQL server

metadata.label: connectionPool

The `sql:ConnectionPool` to be used for the connection. If there is no
`connectionPool` provided, the global connection pool (shared by all clients) will be used
